docs.abstract: Curling athletes are used to competing in a relatively quiet atmosphere, but Sochi crowds have been so boisterous and rowdy that curlers have taken to using hand signals to communicate in an arena filled with unfamiliar noise.

headline.main: At Olympic Curling Matches, Hands Speak Louder Than Words
